page.title: 16St.Laurence's Telscombe
page.content: St.Laurence's stands on high ground above the road. It is of small flint faced construction having a square tower with a clay tile roof. The present church building dates from the early 12th century. The Nave, Chancel and north Aisles (with rounded arches supported by rounded pillars), were built during early Norman times. The Chapel and tower being added about a century later. The east and north walls were raised to their present height and the chapel rebuilt in early Victorian times. Above the Chancel arch and eastern window are painted murals executed in 1905. Telscombe's Rectors are recorded from 1337. Although the Telscombe Living was not officially joined with Piddinghoe until 1877 the two churches shared a rector as early as 1727.
